content:
It's great that you're making progress on "The Silent Patient" despite it being a slow read for you. Sometimes, it's just about persistence and finding a rhythm that works for you.

Reading on your daily commute is a fantastic way to make the most of your time! It's amazing how much you can get through during those short periods of time. Does your commute have any particular scenery or ambiance that helps you get into the reading zone?

By the way, what do you think of the story so far? Are you intrigued by the mystery, or is it the characters that are keeping you invested?
